DataElement.preferredName: Patient Partial Breast Radiation Therapy Clinical Study Participation Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the research study investigating partial breast irradiation, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of a portion of the breast to ionizing radiation conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin, on which a patient is participating.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Partial Breast Radiation Therapy Clinical Study Participation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the participation of patient or participant on a research study investigating partial breast irradiation, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of a portion of the breast to ionizing radiation conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Partial Breast Radiation Therapy Clinical Study Participation
Property.preferredDefinition: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Being or affecting only a part of something.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
